availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James C. Howard (Harlan County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Harlan County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Married to Mary Howard. Father of Mary Jane Howard. Farmer in Harlan County in 1860. Served in the 49th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment as second and first lieutenant from September 19, 1863 to December 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, p. 323.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, District 6, p. 41B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0449.
